situation.title: Shopping
situation.meta_description: If you go shopping, follow the hygienic rules.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

If you go shopping, follow the hygienic rules. While shopping, wear your mask and social distance (especially when waiting in a queue). Before entering the shop disinfect your hands and repeat after returning home. For more protection, shopping in gloves can be recommended. Don't touch any surfaces unnecessarily and use gloves when picking out fruit, vegetables, or baked goods.

If you are part of a higher risk group or are in quarantine (isolation), ask a neighbor, relative, or friend to do your shopping. If this isn't possible, you can reach out to volunteers, who will be happy to help. You can also order online and get your shopping delivered to your doorstep.

Shops and shopping centres can only be entered in groups of 2. The exemption being children under 15 accompanied by an adult from the same household (typically parents, grandparents, or siblings living with the child).

Try to shop online. If you enter a shop, follow all hygienic measures, social distance, and pay by card. We have to shop but it is a place where we encounter a lot of people, so please, be responsible. You are protecting yourself and others.

A summary of hygienic rules can be found in the Hygiene Section.

An overview of how you can help those in need can be found in the Volunteer section.
